ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
The BME senior project is an essential part of the major! You learn so much by developing and executing a research project, things you would never learn otherwise. It ranges from time management to scientific thinking skills, and of course all the technical sides of one's specific project. It will vary, but you can be sure you will learn a lot!

The most important thing for a successful experience is finding a lab that you like. Find work that is interesting to you and a PI with whom you have a good dynamic. Then it will be great!
Really got to take the lead with this project, and do more engineering which I was very excited for
I learned how to conduct a short term project with scheduled deadlines in the BME department, in addition to presenting my data in a scientifically rigorous manner.
I learned the value of research and how much hard work it takes to produce results.

I learned a lot about lab techniques related to organizing my research approach, decellularization of tissues, hydrogel preparation, etc. Moreover, I refined my ability to communicate research results to a broader audience.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strengths and weaknesses of course depend on your research project, mentor, and lab. But in general:

Strengths: highly flexible in terms of the project you can do. Not too much work besides the research itself. 

Weaknesses: It would be great if we could have a better attended final presentation day where we can recognize one another's work and feel a sense of closure. What about instead of 15 min talks, we all do 3 minute lightening talks and mix with other majors as well!
Really great1 allows you to be independent and learn!
This course varies depending on project and mentor, but do keep a regular correspondence with your mentor, especially when things are difficult/not working.
My mentor was great and Professor Staib was very helpful in creating a low-stress environment in which I could really focus on my research and interests.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The key is to find a lab that you like a lot. That makes or breaks it.
yes! Required for Biomedical Engineering majors
This course is entirely dependent on your lab and PI. Overall, it was a nice way to close out the BME major.
You have to if in BME.
Yes because BMEs must take it.
Yes if they are a biomedical engineering senior they are required to take this course.
